comment: Submission front matter incomplete (placeholder authors, empty abstract, placeholder keywords).
Comparative performance claims require inferential statistics and multiplicity control.
Timing methodology under-specified for sub-millisecond claims.
Ranking policy described inconsistently across sections.
Appendix checklist contains stale and contradictory compliance statements.
Limitation language not fully reflected in claim strength.
Protocol table uses invalid python invocation for bash regression script.
Process-management figure has weak scientific payoff in main text.
Results figures omit uncertainty visualization.
Per-episode seed policy in manuscript conflicts with executable code path.
Ranking policy contradictory across manuscript artifacts and generated summary.
Reproduction entrypoints inconsistent and include invalid command path.
Timing conclusions rely on single-pass wall-clock measurements.
Path-length tie-break retained despite Theta* non-comparability caveat.
Expansion extraction defaults can bias ranking when metric keys are missing.
Evidence traceability artifacts are stale and contradictory.
Planner-set description ambiguous about BFS baseline inclusion.
Figure reproducibility metadata lacks script and command provenance.
Novelty framing unassessable because abstract is missing.
Contributions read as implementation hygiene rather than clear methodological novelty.
Positioning versus closest benchmark systems is asserted but not demonstrated.
Contribution scope broader than evidence from current benchmark regime.
Overclaim risk from broad positioning relative to demonstrated scope.
Related-work breadth dilutes novelty focus.
Traceable artifacts framed as primary novelty rather than expected reproducibility practice.
Executed-vs-planned boundary can read as stronger than current evidence.
Manuscript-production workflow figure dilutes technical emphasis.
Placeholder keywords indicate unfinished positioning metadata.
Dependency pin mismatch across entrypoints can reduce reproducibility.
Default planner set reproducibility is not fail-closed.
Inferential-results traceability is incomplete.
Closest-work comparator set mixes direct and adjacent systems.
Speculative hypothesis section dilutes current contribution framing.
Delta wording should emphasize integration novelty rather than component novelty.
